channel.title: briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: How the West was won: K-pop's great assimilation gambit
item.description: The crossover hits stacking Grammy nods this year have little in common with the culture that birthed them — but they're winning the chart game.

item.title: Man Accused of Squirting Ilhan Omar with Vinegar Is Charged With Assault
item.description: Ms. Omar was sprayed with liquid from a syringe as she spoke at a town hall and called for the resignation of Kristi Noem, who leads the Homeland Secu...

item.title: Pizza Cutter and a Fork: A Bizarre Bid to Break Mangione Out of Jail
item.description: Federal prosecutors said a man was arrested after he impersonated an F.B.I. agent during a visit to the federal jail complex in Brooklyn where Luigi M...

item.title: Senate fails to advance spending bills as Democrats push for DHS reforms
item.description: Senators blocked a package of six spending bills that includes funding for the Department of Homeland Security as Democrats continue to push for refor...

item.title: Why these women break the law to sell their eggs for IVF
item.description: Women in India were told they couldn't be paid for their eggs. The result: a black market for eggs from women in need of money to survive.

item.title: Medicare Advantage insurers face new curbs on overcharges in Trump plan
item.description: Federal officials have a plan that could curb billions of dollars in overpayments to Medicare Advantage plans. But will they follow through on it?

item.title: Patrick Schiltz, an Ethicist, Is the Minnesota Judge Blasting ICE
item.description: Judge Patrick Schiltz, an appointee of George W. Bush, became an unlikely critic of the Trump administration’s tactics in Minnesota.

item.title: Police File Hate Crime Charges After Chabad Ramming in Brooklyn
item.description: The police arrested the man, Dan Sohail, after a vehicle was rammed into the Brooklyn headquarters of the Hasidic Jewish organization. The man’s fathe...

item.title: Border czar says he plans to "draw down" ICE and CBP operations in Minnesota
item.description: Tom Homan, who took over leadership of the surge in Minneapolis, says he is working on a plan to reduce the force of federal agents in the Twin Cities...

item.title: One Solution for Too Many A’s? Harvard Considers Giving A-Pluses
item.description: Harvard University has been trying to cut back how many A grades professors give. Now, 53 percent of grades are A’s, down from 60 percent.

item.title: NATO to Hold Military Exercise Without U.S., Its Largest Member
item.description: The operation, Steadfast Dart, comes as President Trump has been accused of undermining the alliance and will be watched closely to see how well the a...

item.title: Canada Signs Auto Deal With South Korea, Moving Further from the U.S.
item.description: The agreement, while scarce on details, is the latest step by Prime Minister Mark Carney to reduce Canada’s reliance on trade with the U.S.

item.title: Southern Africa Faces Devastating Flooding During Rainy Season
item.description: More than 100 deaths have been confirmed across South Africa, Zimbabwe and Mozambique, with the rains expected to continue through February.

item.title: Venezuelan Lawmakers Approve Sweeping Overhaul of Oil Sector
item.description: Bowing to Trump administration pressure, the new legislation improves conditions for foreign oil companies and opens the way to slash the taxes they p...

item.title: A Global Pop Music Melting Pot
item.description: The era of American dominance is over. Music now comes from artists everywhere listening to each other.
